The other two doctors decide to split the sick doctor's patients evenly between them. How many patients does each doctor now have?

Now, one of the doctors gets sick and can't see any patients. Let's say Doctor C is the one who's sick. So, Doctor C's 4 patients need to be taken care of by the other two doctors, Doctor A and Doctor B.

They decide to split Doctor C's patients evenly between them. Since there are 4 patients and 2 doctors, each of the remaining doctors will take 2 of Doctor C's patients.

So, Doctor A will now have his original 4 patients plus 2 from Doctor C, making a total of 6 patients.

Similarly, Doctor B will have his original 4 patients plus 2 from Doctor C, also making a total of 6 patients.

And Doctor C will have 0 patients since he's sick and can't see anyone.
